trans-unit.source: Create a multi-VM deployment using the Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a multi-VM deployment using the Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a multi VM deployment using the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a multi VM deployment using the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Create a multi-VM deployment using the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Create a multi-VM deployment using the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: The following script will show you how to configure a multi-VM multi-cloud service deployment in a VNET using Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).
trans-unit.target: The following script will show you how to configure a multi-VM multi-cloud service deployment in a VNET using Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).

trans-unit.source: The image below explains how your deployment will look after the script completes:
trans-unit.target: The image below explains how your deployment will look after the script completes:

trans-unit.source: The script creates one VM (**servervm**) in cloud service **servercs** with two data disks attached and two VMs (**clientvm1, clientvm2**) in the cloud service **workercs**.
trans-unit.target: The script creates one VM (**servervm**) in cloud service **servercs** with two data disks attached and two VMs (**clientvm1, clientvm2**) in the cloud service **workercs**.

trans-unit.source: Both the cloud services are placed in the VNET **samplevnet**.
trans-unit.target: Both the cloud services are placed in the VNET **samplevnet**.

trans-unit.source: The **servercs** cloud service also has an endpoint configured for external connectivity.
trans-unit.target: The **servercs** cloud service also has an endpoint configured for external connectivity.

trans-unit.source: CLI script to make it happen
trans-unit.target: CLI script to make it happen

trans-unit.source: The code to set this up is relatively straightforward:
trans-unit.target: The code to set this up is relatively straightforward:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You will likely need to change the cloud service names servercs and workercs to be unique cloud service names
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You will likely need to change the cloud service names servercs and workercs to be unique cloud service names

trans-unit.source: As is the code to tear it down:
trans-unit.target: As is the code to tear it down:

trans-unit.source: The –q option suppresses the interactive confirmation for deleting objects, -b cleans up the disks / blobs associated with the VM.
trans-unit.target: The –q option suppresses the interactive confirmation for deleting objects, -b cleans up the disks / blobs associated with the VM.

trans-unit.target: Generic forms of the commands used
